intro: Amaracarpus archiboldianus, commonly known as the Archibold's amara, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant in suitable climates.
